noun.description: A unit of liquid capacity equal to a quarter of a gallon or two pints, equivalent in the US to approximately 0.94 liter and in Britain to approximately 1.13 liters.
The fourth of eight standard parrying positions.
(in piquet) a sequence of four cards of the same suit.

origin: Middle English: from Old French quarte, from Latin quarta (pars) fourth (part), from quartus fourth, from quattuor four.
